bestBHT.bht: Jesus's command, Give ye them to eat, was an astounding and urgent call to action. It reminded the disciples that no situation is desperate or unmanageable to Him. Christ measures our duty by His command, not by our resources, teaching us to seek His kingdom and be satisfied with what we have. Through faith and obedience, He equips us to provide for others. As we trust in Him, He will ensure that all our needs are met and that we can be a source of provision for those around us.

John Calvin: To those who seek the kingdom of God, and his righteousness, all other things will be added.
Those who wish to have Christ for their provider, must first learn not to long for refined luxuries, but to be satisfied with barley-bread.
Christ determined that his power should be handled by them.
Philip Schaff: Obedience seemed impossible, but they did obey through Christ’s power providing the means for them.
Duty is measured by Christ’s command, not by our resources.
Archibald T. Robertson: Give ye them to eat. It is the urgent aorist of instant action. The disciples were to learn that 'no situation appears to Him desperate, no crisis unmanageable'."
The emphasis is on υμεις in contrast with their 'send away'.
John Gill: They need not depart; meaning so long as he was with them, who had power enough to provide a sufficient meal for them, as well as by a word speaking, to heal their diseases.
However, to try their faith, and make way for the working of the following miracle, he says to them, give ye them to eat.
Such provisions as you have along with you.

bhtAttempts.bht: In this passage, Jesus gives the disciples an astounding command: Give ye them to eat. Despite feeling inadequate and overwhelmed, the disciples obeyed through Christ's power and were able to provide for the crowd. It is a reminder that no situation is desperate or unmanageable to Him. Christ measures our duty by His command, not by our resources. He wants us to learn to be satisfied with what we have and trust Him to provide. As we seek the kingdom of God, all other things will be added to us. Therefore, let us have faith and be obedient to Christ's commands, knowing that He will equip us to meet the needs of others.

Jesus's command to the disciples, Give ye them to eat, was both astounding and urgent. Despite feeling inadequate, they obeyed through Christ's power, teaching them that no situation is unmanageable to Him. Christ measures our duty by His command, not our resources, reminding us to seek His kingdom and be satisfied with what we have. Through faith and obedience, He equips us to provide for others, demonstrating that He is our ultimate provider in every circumstance.

Jesus's command, Give ye them to eat, was an astounding and urgent call to action. The disciples, feeling inadequate, were reminded that no situation is unmanageable to Him. Christ measures our duty by His command, not our resources, teaching us to seek His kingdom and be content with what we have. Through faith and obedience, He empowers us to be providers for others. As we trust in Him as our ultimate provider, He will ensure that all our needs are taken care of.

Jesus's command, Give ye them to eat, was an astounding and urgent call to action for the disciples. It reminded them that no situation is unmanageable to Him. Christ measures our duty by His command, not our resources, teaching us to seek His kingdom and be content with what we have. Through faith and obedience, He empowers us to be providers for others. Trusting in Him as our ultimate provider ensures that all our needs will be taken care of.

Jesus's command, Give ye them to eat, was an astounding and urgent call to action. It reminded the disciples that no situation is desperate or unmanageable to Him. Christ measures our duty by His command, not by our resources, teaching us to seek His kingdom and be satisfied with what we have. Through faith and obedience, He equips us to provide for others. As we trust in Him, He will ensure that all our needs are met and that we can be a source of provision for those around us.
